Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utilities

  • public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Tahnik Mustasin on 10/06/2016. This file contains all the utility method needed for this program. I've made this class Singleton as it doesn't have any state. This class might get really big but all the methods might not be used. So loading it in compile time will be wastage of resources.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Utilities getInstance()

      • readFile

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method reads a file and returns a list of lines. It uses verifyLine() to verify each lines. Terminated if a line doesn't have at least a package name and "->"
        Parameters:
        fileName - the filename from where to read the line
        Returns:
        lines The individual lines from the file. Ignores blank line

      • verifyLine

        public boolean verifyLine(java.lang.String line)
        This method verifies the lines in a file using complex regex
        Parameters:
        line - Takes one line
        Returns:
        verificationPassed If the line has passed the verification

      • splitLines

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> splitLines(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lines)
        Splits the lines by space using a Hashmap where Package name is the key and dependencies are value Reason for using a Hashmap here is it's easy to find the package when creating package class later and add dependencies
        Parameters:
        lines - Takes ArrayList of lines which will be split up
        Returns:
        splitLines Hashmap of lines split in words

      • checkIfLineIsEmpty

        public boolean checkIfLineIsEmpty(java.lang.String line)
        Checks if line is empty
        Parameters:
        line - A single line
        Returns:
        boolean is line empty or not

      • getPackageList

        public java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,Package> getPackageList(java.lang.String filename)
        This method uses the Hashmap of splitLines and uses them to create packages and add their dependencies
        Parameters:
        filename - takes the filename of txt file
        Returns:
        packages the concurrent hashmap of packages where the each packages contains all the dependencies

      • printPackageDependency

        public void printPackageDependency(java.lang.String[] args)
        Prints the requested package and their dependencies.
        Parameters:
        args - takes command line arguments to find the text file and package request

      • testFileName

        public boolean testFileName(java.lang.String filename)
        Tests if the filename exists and it's not a directory
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of text file
        Returns:
        boolean if the filename is correct

      • printDependencies

        public void printDependencies(java.util.ArrayList<Package> pkgs,
                              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> dependencies,
                              java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,Package> packages)
        A recursive function which goes through each dependencies to find out their transitive dependencies. The reason to use a recursive function is that the Package class contains an arraylist of dependencies the type of which is also Package. Because all this dependencies might have their own dependencies, a recursive function is the best way get them.
        Parameters:
        pkgs - Initial dependencies of a package
        dependencies - Dependencies which will include transitive dependencies
        packages - List of packages from the text file
